channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Coronavirus: Â£5 steroid dexamethasone 'reduces risk of death'
item.description: The results from the RECOVERY trial - led by Oxford University - suggest the steroid can prevent death in one in eight ventilated coronavirus patients and one in 25 on oxygen.

item.title: Shaken and bruised Paddy McGuinness describes terrifying Top Gear crash
item.description: The presenter, 46, took to Instagram later that day to reassure fans that he was doing alright after the incident, and he looked shaken and bruised in the video message.

item.title: Donald Trump signs police reform order banning chokeholds
item.description: Donald Trump unveiled his police reform executive order Tuesday, including setting up a register of bad actor cops, as he bashed Barack Obama for not doing something about it during his tenure.

item.title: Police chief slams far-right thug who kicked officer to ground
item.description: Detective Constable Steve Nicholls said he is pleased Daniel Allan has been convicted and hopes the conviction serves as a warning to those who came to London just to cause violence.

item.title: Coronavirus: Berlin households in lockdown after positive tests
item.description: Officials in the southern district of Neukoelln said the outbreak involved homes in seven different locations and in some cases with 10 people living together.

item.title: Beijing back in lockdown: Parts of the city are fenced off and new travel bans introduced
item.description: Parts of Beijing have been fenced off after a new outbreak of the coronavirus, believed to have stemmed from the Xinfadi wholesale food market, has caused 106 new Covid-19 cases.

item.title: US government user data requests to Google rose 510% since 2010
item.description: A report reveals data requests by the US government to Google has increased by 510% since 2010. It also found that in 2019. The tech giant received 157,435 user data requests worldwide.

item.title: Disability activist with Down's syndrome leads charge to change Northern Ireland abortion law
item.description: Heidi Crowter and 18,000 signatories demanded that MPs do not pass a Bill endorsing regulations that allow the abortion of babies with non-fatal disabilities until the point of birth in Northern Ireland.
item.media:description: Heidi Crowter, a young woman with DownÂ´s syndrome from Coventry, who has presented a petition to Number 10 against an abortion law which makes her feel like she would be "better off dead".

item.title: Met Office issues severe weather warning for thunderstorms and flooding
item.description: Scenes of flooding and sudden heavy showers in Manchester come just days before the country will be hit with a heatwave set to send temperatures rocketing to 82F (28C) by Wednesday next week.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Shielding plan for 2m most at risk ends in July
item.description: The Health Service Journal has said the 2.2 million clinically extremely vulnerable people who were asked to shield this year will be told they no longer need to isolate from the end of July.

item.title: David Cameron leads ex-prime ministers in attacking Boris Johnson for axing foreign aid department
item.description: In what is believed to be his first policy intervention since quitting in 2016 ex-premier Mr Cameron joined his Labour predecessors to criticise Mr Johnson this afternoon.

item.title: Prince Charles and the Duchess of Cornwall will visit NHS workers at Gloucestershire Royal Hospital
item.description: Prince William, Prince Charles and the Duchess of Cornwall were seen out for the first time in months today as they returned to royal duties with visits to hospitals in Norfolk and Gloucestershire.

item.title: Disgraced President of RIBA returns to position after affair
item.description: Married father-of-two Alan Jones, 55, - who has been described as 'deeply religious' - had a relationship with Sanoara Begom, 40. He returned to the role after apologising to Riba members.

item.title: EastEnders airs 'final' episode with Sharon Mitchell cliffhanger
item.description: The hit BBC One soap will keep loyal viewers in suspense as they ended the show with a dramaticÂ Sharon Mitchell cliffhanger.

item.title: Kylie Jenner's daughter Stormi makes her Vogue cover debut as they pose together in at-home shoot
item.description: Kylie Jenner and daughter Stormi are the cover stars of the Czech Republic issue of Vogue, Vogue Czechoslovakia's 24th edition this month.

item.title: Turkey planned 2014 invasion of Greece at height of Syrian war
item.description: The Turkish plans are believed to have centred around maintaining offensive and deterrence capabilities on the western front, while moving troops during the war in Syria.

item.title: BLM: Protest in Oxford before Cecil Rhodes statue meeting
item.description: Hundreds of Black Lives Matter protesters took to the streets of Oxford today, ahead of a meeting of Oriel College board members to discuss the future of a statue of Cecil Rhodes.

item.title: Street Cat Named Bob, who turned heroin addict James Bowen into a best-selling author, dies aged 14
item.description: A street cat called Bob who helped transform a homeless heroin addict James Bowen into a best-selling author has died at the age of 14. Bob and Mr Bowen's story as been told through books and films.

item.title: Glowing green oxygen is detected for the first time in Mars' atmosphere
item.description: ESA's ExoMars Orbitor has made an astonishing discovery while circling Mars. The craft observed glowing green oxygen in the Red Planet's atmosphere for the first time.

item.title: Instagram newsfeeds favour posts with 'scantily clad' women
item.description: A report finds that Instagram may be boosting 'scantily-clad' photos shared by influencers on newsfeeds to encourage them to share more semi-nude pictures.

item.title: Japanese report says humans will talk to pets via virtual reality
item.description: Japan's Science and Technology Ministry has published an annual white paper making a series of surprising predictions about what life will be like by 2040, including the ability to 'talk' to animals.

item.title: Boris Johnson congratulated Marcus Rashford on schools victory
item.description: Boris Johnson revealed he had 'personally congratulated' the England footballer in a phone call this afternoon for his campaign to make sure disadvantaged families get support during the break.

item.title: UK records 233 more Covid-19 victims
item.description: Department of Health figures say the official final number of victims is now 41,969 - but separate data shows the actual number of fatalities is in the region of 53,000.

item.title: Rod Stewart and Penny Lancaster celebrate wedding anniversary
item.description: The rocker, 75, and his model wife, 49, looked happier than ever as they toasted their 13th wedding anniversary with a takeaway and a glass of wine on Monday.

item.title: Melania bragged about size of Donald Trump's manhood
item.description: The future First Lady admonished close friends when they joked Trump must have a small penis because he has small hands, cutting in to remark: 'Don't say this -he's a real man.'

item.title: Coronavirus: 45% of asymptomatic patients may have lung damage
item.description: A new study from Scripps Research in La Jolla, California, found that among 76 asymptomatic coronavirus patients on the Diamond Princess, 54% had lung damage indicated on CT scans.

item.title: COVID-19 can pass between people up to THREE FEET even with a mask
item.description: Researchers from the University of Nicosia in Cyprus examined the spread of the deadly COVID-19 virus under different conditions as part of their new study.

item.title: Boston Dynamics' robotic 'dog' Spot goes on sale for nearly $75,000 a piece
item.description: 'Spot', made by the high-profile robotics firm, Boston Dynamics, will retail for $74,500 and comes with some restrictions that dictate it must be deployed for the 'beneficial use' of humans.

item.title: Airbnb reveals the 10 most wish-listed UK homes since the lockdown began
item.description: Britons haven't been travelling much recently - obviously - but their wanderlust has not been dampened. According to Airbnb they've been lusting after staycations in jaw-dropping properties.

item.title: Talented footballer dies just weeks after blood cancer diagnosis
item.description: Joe Aspinall, who attended Coastal Bend College in Texas, passed away on June 10 at Huddersfield Royal Infirmary. He had returned from Texas to Highburton at the start of the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: Twenty Indian soldiers are killed in brutal hand-to-hand fighting with Chinese soldiers at border
item.description: The Indian army said in a statement on Tuesday that a 'violent faceoff' took place in Galwan valley in the Ladakh region on Monday night 'with casualties on both sides.'

item.title: Man, 29, is jailed for 16 years for 'brutal' rape of cleaner in her 40s who feared she would die
item.description: Luke West (pictured) from Southampton, Hampshire, was found guilty of rape and grievous bodily harm at Winchester Crown Court.

item.title: Royal Ascot revellers dress up in all their race day finery in their gardens
item.description: Royal Ascot fans have donned their best hat and dress from the comfort of their own home today as the race meeting, held in Berkshire, commenced for the first time behind closed doors.

item.title: Hitler-loving Medellin druglord Carlos Lehder Rivas released
item.description: Carlos Lehder Rivas, who was among the traffickers who helped smuggle cocaine from Colombia to the U.S. in the 1970s and 1980s, has been extradited to Germany.

item.title: Labour's Lisa Nandy demands Foreign Office remove five giant 'racist' British Empire murals
item.description: The pieces byÂ Sigismund Goetze include images of empire seen as problematic by campaigners, including a representation of Africa as a little boy surrounded by white Anglo-Saxon adults.

item.title: Cineworld announce they are reopening cinemas in England on July 10 with socially-distanced seating
item.description: Cinema goers will be able to enjoy their popcorn while watching the latest blockbuster movies after Cineworld announced it was reopening its movie theatres across England on July 10.

item.title: Shops in England suffer 45% DROP in footfall on first day
item.description: While pictures taken yesterday showed long queues and bustling crowds of shoppers at the likes of Sports Direct and Primark, there was no huge rush to Britain's high streets today.

item.title: Former Arsenal youth footballer, 22, faces jail after admitting sexual activity with 14-year-old
item.description: Tyrell Robinson, 22, who appeared at Bradford Crown Court, admitted engaging in sexual activity with a child, making an indecent image of a child and distributing an indecent image of a child.

item.title: Migrant workers earn just Â£1.08 an hour making PPE gloves for firms that supply NHS
item.description: Staff employed by Top Glove in Malaysia, the world's largest manufacturer of medical gloves, have told Channel 4 News of the level of exploitation seen in factories.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Boris Johnson 'hopes' to change two-metre rule
item.description: The Prime Minister appealed to the nation for patience as he told anxious workers and business owners 'we hear you' as he fronted tonight's Downing Street press conference.

item.title: Primary school pupils suffer emotionally in lockdown, study says
item.description: Primary school children are displaying more signs of emotional and mental health problems during the coronavirus lockdown, a new study by the University of Oxford has revealed.

item.title: People with some health conditions have more coronavirus 'doorways'
item.description: People who suffer from diabetes, lung disease and high blood pressure have more cellular doorways through which the virus can enter than do healthy people, Brazilian and American scientists found.

item.title: The UK 'not the most attractive place' for foreign nurses and doctors' to work post-Covid
item.description: Chief executive of the British Nuffield Trust health think-tank, Nigel Edwards, said: 'I suspect we are not the most attractive for health professionals now after our performance in the pandemic'.

item.title: 'The cast is at war!' Hollyoaks stars 'threaten to quit' amid show's racism row
item.description: The cast is said to be 'at war' followingÂ Rachel Adedeji's accusations of 'behind-the-scenes' racism and claimsÂ that co-star Lysette Anthony is 'actual trash'.

item.title: Boy, 6, overcomes speech disorder to launch garden business
item.description: Brave Alfie Bradley, of Redruth, Cornwall, has battled a severe speech disorder to set up his own firm Alfred's Cutting Services during lockdown. Now he aims to become a millionaire.

item.title: Shocking moment men use a DIGGER and plank of wood to lever parked car out of their wayÂ
item.description: Two men have been filmed using a digger to push a plank of wood against the wheel of a Ford Mondeo and spin it out of their way. A crowd formed to watch the men shunt the parked car round into the road.

item.title: Britain's fastest snowboarder spends his summer transforming basement into Â£475,000 apartmentÂ
item.description: Jamie Barrow, 28, has transformed the property in Bath from a 'dungeon' into a dream home now worth almost half a million pounds.

item.title: Priti Patel blasts 'mindless hooligans' who sprayed graffiti over Witham war memorial
item.description: Home Secretary Priti Patel says she is 'disgusted' after vandals painted a 'crude phallic symbol' over a war memorial in her constituency of Witham, Essex over the weekend.

item.title: How Marcus Rashford has become a 'lockdown hero'
item.description: The 22-year-old star says leaving home aged 11 to join Manchester United's academy when his single mother Melanie struggled to feed the family has driven his free school meals campaign.

item.title: Luke Horsfield left with severe scarring after Â£1,250 botched hair transplant surgery
item.description: Luke Horsfield, 26, an IT technician from Bradford, was worried about his thinning hairline and found a clinic in Turkey which would perform a transplant for half the price it would be in the UK.

item.title: Grieving mother's fury over early release date for couple who killed her daughter
item.description: Sophie Taylor, 22, was driven to her death inÂ Adamsdown, Cardiff inÂ August 2016 after a high-speed pursuit by Michael Wheeler, 23, and Melissa Pesticcio, 24.

item.title: Harry Dunn's family blast Boris Johnson's letters that arrived on eve of judicial review
item.description: The Dunn family are set for a judicial review hearing with the Foreign Office and police on Thursday in which they will dispute the diplomatic immunity claimed by American Anne Sacoolas.

item.title: Woman dies after running into closed glass door in bank
item.description: Footage shows married mother-of-two Beena Jiju Paul, 46, inside a bank in Perumbavoor, India. She dashes back towards the door after leaving her keys outside, colliding with the glass pane.

item.title: DIY enthusiast DYES bedroom carpet in under two hours for Â£1
item.description: Writing on the Mrs Hinch Cleaning Tips Facebook group, the homeowner from Barnsley explained how the dyeing process also brought her carpet up 'like new'.

item.title: Coronavirus UK BBC will have to air MORE repeats next year
item.description: The BBC will air more repeats next year as the ramifications of the covid lockdown on filming are felt by the broadcaster. Social distancing rules have had an impact on a number of shows.

item.title: Is this Belgium's 'Crazy Brabant killer' who massacred 28 people in supermarkets?
item.description: Known as the 'Crazy Brabant Killers', the assailants killed 28 shoppers and wounded hundreds more in attacks on supermarket car parks in the Brussels area between 1982 and 1985.

item.title: Stunning images of SpaceX's latest Starlink satellite launch
item.description: The images surfaced on social media as space fans took to their gardens to watch theÂ 5:21 a.m. EDT (10:21 GMT) launch fromÂ Cape Canaveral, Florida on June 13.

item.title: 13-year-old 'Amazon warrior' buried with her weapons 2,600 years ago finally identified as female
item.description: The remains of the warrior - who had a wart on her face - were found at Saryg-Bulun, in the Tuva republic, in 1988 and assumed to have belonged to a young man.

item.title: Pilot who died when US Air Force F-15C fighter jet crashed in the North Sea is namedÂ
item.description: The US Air Force said1st Lt Kenneth Allen arrived at the 48th Fighter Wing at RAF Lakenheath in Suffolk earlier this year and is survived by his wife and parents.

item.title: AstraZeneca boss claims Oxford University's Covid-19 vaccine is likely to protect for a YEAR
item.description: AstraZeneca's CEO Pascal Soriot made the claims to Belgian radio today. It comes despite there being no scientific evidence the AZD1222 vaccine , developed by Oxford University, works.

item.title: 'Miracle' newborn baby almost died after crying so hard she developed HOLES in both her lungs
item.description: Little Robyn Theaker spent 11 days in intensive care at York Hospital after she was born five weeks early on March 17 to parents Kylie and Craig.

item.title: Honeybee queens don't just buzz but also 'quack and toot', study says
item.description: Scientists monitored vibrations in 25 hives based in England and France to establish the role of 'quacks' and 'toots'. Two queens were never heard 'tooting' at the same time. (Left: Queen bee)

item.title: Prince William has been 'keeping tabs' on Harry via 'low key and casual' Zoom chats, insider claims
item.description: The Duke of Cambridge, 37, reportedly checks in with his younger sibling in the evening after supper with Kate, 38, when their three children have gone to bed, a source told Fabulous Digital.

item.title: Mother shared her mouth-watering 'no cook' Milky Way pudding recipe
item.description: Laura Middleton, from Kingston-upon-Hull, delighted people with a sweet tooth by sharing her Milkybar pudding to the Facebook group Extreme Couponing and Bargains UK.

item.title: Mozart's Sonata for Two Pianos can help to reduce the number of seizures in patients with epilepsy
item.description: Researchers from Canada found that the beneficial effect of the composition by the Austrian maestro is not conferred by a similar, scrambled version of the piece.

item.title: Queen misses out on Royal Ascot visit for first time...
item.description: More than 300,000 guests, dressed in their finery, usually gather for the five-day sporting and social highlight in Berkshire, including the monarch (pictured during the 2019 carriage procession).

item.title: Rioting on the streets of Paris as health workers demand better pay and conditions
item.description: Riot police used tear gas and baton charges as they fought with protesters by Les Invalides in the centre of the city on Tuesday afternoon.

item.title: One in five people worldwide have underlying conditions that put them at risk for COVID-19
item.description: London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine researchers estimate that 22% of the world's population is at-risk for coronavirus, including 31% of Europeans and 27% of North Americans.

item.title: Minister suggests 'battle camp' for vandalism of memorials
item.description: Penny Mordaunt said the scenes at the Cenotaph and other sites during Black Lives Matter and Far Right demonstrations had been 'disturbing'.

item.title: West Midlands police chief apologises for 'historic racism'
item.description: David Thompson of West Midlands Police backed his officers 'taking a knee' in solidarity with anti-racism campaigners.

item.title: Miniature pony foal is thriving after being nursed by humans following the death of his mother
item.description: Hank, a one-month-old miniature Shetland pony from Doncaster, has been raised by daughter-mother duo Jodie and Lorraine Waite after his mother died from illness two weeks after his birth.

item.title: Coleen Rooney 'SET UP Rebekah Vardy' says Peter Shilton's wife
item.description: Coleen Rooney attempted to knock Rebekah Vardy off the top spot ahead of her return to the UK, claims Peter Shilton's wife Stephanie.

item.title: UK quarantine form dropdown includes countries that don't exist
item.description: Those filling out the Home Office's website where able to claim they were from places such as Czechoslovakia and the USSR - both of which have not existed for almost three decades.

item.title: Britain's most senior surgeon warns it could take five years to clear backlog
item.description: ProfessorÂ Alderson told the House of Commons Health and Social Care Select Committee today the only way to kick-start routine ops was for NHS England to use private beds it bought up in March.

item.title: Sculpture of a fat bald ma appears next to empty Edward Colston plinth
item.description: The art installation emblazoned with 'St George was Turkish' was first seen yesterday morning chained to a lamppost in Bristol city centre, before later disappearing.

item.title: Mayor slammed for comparing Black Lives Matter protesters to monkeys climbing on a car
item.description: Peter Kraus, from Wales, shared a Facebook post to his page on Monday which appeared to likenÂ an image of black protesters to a photograph of monkeys.

item.title: Economic hit from pandemic 'NOT part of contingency planning'
item.description: The omission emerged asÂ Whitehall mandarins were quizzed about the Government's readiness and response regarding the outbreak of coronavirus.

item.title: Teenage mob steals scooter from middle aged man
item.description: This is the shocking moment a group of youths surround a man pushing a scooter and drag it from him using force while filming the incident in Peckham, south London.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Racism to blame for risk in BAME communities
item.description: Public Health England today published the second report from its investigation into how and why black, Asian and ethnic minority people are being worse affected by the coronavirus in the UK.

item.title: Opium poppies bloom on Conservative MP Richard Drax's land
item.description: Acres of land owned by the Tory MP for South Dorset Richard Drax have been turned over to the poppies since 2011 to produce morphine for the NHS.

item.title: Dramatic moment Russian fighter jets intercept U.S. military aircraft
item.description: According to reports, American B-52 H strategic bombers were spotted in the skies above the neutral waters of the Baltic Sea on Monday.

item.title: 3,500-year-old Bronze Age settlement remains found on Silk Road
item.description: Experts found the remnants of five Bronze Age buildings, ceramic pieces and animal bones beneath a group of tombs belonging to nomadic people in modern-day Xinjiang, China.

item.title: Michael Gove warns the EU that Britain wants a post-Brexit trade agreement done by the autumn
item.description: The Cabinet Office Minister faced MPs the day after Boris Johnson held a virtual meeting with senior Brussels figures designed to add 'oomph' to stalled talks.

item.title: French 16-year-old climbing prodigy Luce Douady plummets 500ft to her death in fall from cliffÂ
item.description: Luce Douady, who fell to her death in the French alps, was seen as one of the brightest young talents in the sport of climbing, which will be introduced to the Olympics in Tokyo next year.

item.title: EU opens antitrust investigation into Apple over app store and Apple Pay
item.description: The probe was launched following allegations from competitors that Apple's mobile app store and payment platform practices distort competition.

item.title: 'Digital sanitiser' using UV light kills coronavirus, scientists claimÂ
item.description: Scientists have created a 'digital sanitiser' which uses a device attached to smartphone's torch to kill bacteria and viruses, including the coronavirus.

item.title: 'Crying' donkey being driven to a slaughterhouse 'desperately kowtows' to passersby
item.description: The heartbreaking video taken in north-eastern China shows the poor animal repeatedly bowing its head while being strapped at the back of a truck, seemingly with tears in its eyes.

item.title: Willie Thorne placed in induced coma in Spain after former snooker star suffers respiratory failure
item.description: The 66-year-old, who announced he was battling leukaemia in March, was taken to hospital last week with a dangerously low blood pressure.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Jason Manford starts as Iceland delivery driver
item.description: It comes a month after the supermarketÂ offered him a job after his application to work as a driver for Tesco was rejected - a decision he claimed to be 'livid' about

item.title: Ex-student nurse, 27, is jailed for making bogus emergency calls
item.description: Sharna Dixon, 27, from Sheerness, Kent, pictured, was jailed for two years after admitting assaulting a police officer and making hundreds of fake emergency calls.

item.title: New Zealand confirms two NEW cases of coronaviru days after it 'eliminated' COVID-19Â
item.description: The two infections on Tuesday,Â both acquired during recent travel to the UK, ended a 24-day streak of no new infections in the country.

item.title: North Korea 'blows up' liaison office with South after Kim Jong Un sister threatened military action
item.description: An explosion was heard and smoke (pictured)Â seen rising from the North Korean border city of Kaesong on Tuesday, near where the North-South liaison office is located.

item.title: Bank of England set to launch up to Â£150bn of QE
item.description: With the UK economy shrinking by a record 20 per cent in April and further job losses in May, the Bank is under pressure to continue maintaining a high level of monetary stimulus.

item.title: Princesses Mako and Kako mark anniversary of the death of Empress Kojun - wife of Emperor Hirohito
item.description: Sisters Princess Mako, 29, and Princess Kako, 26, the granddaughters of Emperor Naruhito, arrived at the Musashi imperial graveyard in Tokyo wearing identical dove grey dresses and trilbies.
item.media:credit: The Asahi Shimbun via Getty Imag

item.title: PIERS MORGAN:Â If you support BLM protests you have no right to say Trump's rally should be canceled
item.description: Trump's Tulsa rally has been criticized as mass gatherings during the pandemic are dangerous. However, you can't support the BLM protests, with no criticism of the lack of social distancing.

item.title: Jealous ex, 20, stabbed her former lover's new girlfriend with kitchen knife
item.description: Imogen Hughes, 20, plunged a kitchen knife into Liberty Hanley's leg as she sat with Hughes' ex-partner in a car park in Wrexham, north Wales.

item.title: Woman admits she's been regularly breaking lockdown rules to have sex with her businessman lover
item.description: Monica Holmes, 34, fromÂ Harrogate, visited her partner throughout the UK's coronavirus-related quarantine, despite being aware that their nights of passion were in breach of the guidelines.

item.title: Father's Day gift guide: Femail reveals the BEST gifts
item.description: FEMAIL has found the best presents available to buy online across a range of categories including food and drink, health and fitness and gifts for the house and garden.

item.title: Credit card rates hit record high as banks squeeze poorer borrowers
item.description: Credit card rates hit a record high this month despite a record low base rate as providers hiked the cost of borrowing for those with poor credit histories or turned down by mainstream banks.

item.title: Flop cat! Hilarious moment Simba the kitten tries to leap on top of a fridge but falls VERY shortÂ
item.description: Six-month-old Simba bit off more than he could chew when he tried to jump up onto a fridge from a kitchen counter to get another cat's food at their home in Dunsborough, Western Australia.

item.title: Church will remove 'Chocolate covered C**n' headstone of blackface dancer GH Elliott
item.description: GH Elliot's headstone, and that of another singer who performed in blackface in the 1930s, wereÂ covered up last week at St Margaret's church in Rottingdean, east Sussex.

item.title: Fury as Munira Mirza appointed to set up race commissionÂ
item.description: Downing Street advisers are said to be keen for the PM to take high-profile stands on cultural issues, focusing on improving life chances rather than bowing to pressure from the Left.

item.title: Ancient humans feasted on shellfish during one migration out of Africa
item.description: Archaeologists from the University of York studied fossil reefs near to the now-submerged Red Sea shorelines that marked prehistoric migratory routes.

item.title: Driver and passenger miraculously survive after their car is squashed between two lorries
item.description: Heart-stopping footage shows the huge truck racing down the road before rear-ending white car at a high speed and squashing it against the other lorry on the front in south-eastern China.

item.title: Charles Spencer shares a rare throwback he found in his attic of a young King Edward
item.description: Earl Spencer, the younger brother of the late Princess Diana , has shared a rare throwback picture of King Edward VIII and King George VI as young boys.

item.title: Kate and Gerry McCann hit back at German prosecutor's claims
item.description: The parents said: 'The widely reported news that we have a received a letter from the German authorities that states there is evidence or proof that Madeleine is dead is FALSE.'

item.title: Grade I-listed manor house that was once home to Sir William Cowper is for sale for Â£2.2m
item.description: A Grade I-listed manor in Canterbury, Kent, formerly owned by Sir William Cowper, the man credited with uniting England and Scotland three hundred years ago, is on the market for Â£2.2m.

item.title: David Attenborough teaches primary school pupils geography as he finally appears on BBC Bitesize
item.description: The renowned naturalist has narrated short videos for the BBC about the world's continents, latitude and longitude, climate and cartography for UK schoolchildren under the age of 11.

item.title: Tony Godfrey who died in care home without living relatives is revealed as motorbike racing champion
item.description: Tenacious Tony Godfrey passed away in a care home in Bournemouth last December without a will or any known relatives to inherit his Â£30,000 estate.

item.title: Woman sparks a discussion about lifestyle habits to leave in the past
item.description: An anonymous woman from the UK, told Mumsnet that she's been reflecting on her lifestyle habits during lockdown, and said that she won't be spending as much on clothes her kids grow out of.

item.title: Madeleine McCann suspect Brueckner is investigated over rape and murder of 13-year-old German boy
item.description: In 1998, 13-year-old Tristan Brubach (pictured), was brutally murdered in Frankfurt, Germany. Christian Brueckner, the man suspected of killing Maddie, is now under investigation.

item.title: Swimmers face strict rules when pools reopen after months on lockdown
item.description: Swim England, the sport's governing body, said the guidelines focus on 'reducingÂ the risk of Covid-19 transmission within the swimming pool environment'.

item.title: High doses of ketamine can switch off the brain, study says
item.description: High doses of ketamine, a drug commonly used in humans as an anaesthetic, can temporarily switch off the brain, say researchers from the University of Cambridge.

item.title: China's war robot 'Sharp Claw I' is armed with a machine gun and night vision
item.description: The remote-control machine, described as 'small but lethal', is designed to travel through complicated terrains at a fast speed and replace human soldiers in dangerous missions.

item.title: Tyson Fury blasts Anthony Joshua's 'bull****' Black Lives Matter speech
item.description: Joshua, the IBF, WBA, WBO and IBO world heavyweight champion, was heavily criticised after addressing protesters in his hometown of Watford earlier this month.

item.title: Mother-of-two science teacher, 39, drowned when BMW hit pool of water and flipped into River Trent
item.description: Mother-of-two Emma Fegan, 39, hit a pool of water in her BMW and her car flipped off the road and into the nearby River Trent in Nottinghamshire, an inquest heard.

item.title: Two Michelin-starred restaurant The Ledbury in London's Notting Hill will not reopen after lockdown
item.description: The Ledbury in Notting Hill, which has two Michelin stars and regularly features among the top ranked eateries in the world, has 'no route to reopening'.

item.title: Mother and daughter outraged over supermarket crop top ban
item.description: Chantell Humphreys, 46, and her 18-year-old daughter Isabelle were both wearing 'crop tops' when they visited the Asda store in Broadstairs, Kent on Sunday afternoon.

item.title: Marks and Spencer delight fans with launch of vegan 'avoca-dough' bread
item.description: M&S says its new 'avocadough' buns are perfect for a summer barbecue, and taste like a classic brioche. The buns cost Â£1.15 for a pack of two and are made with avocado and coconut oil.

item.title: Teen, 19, reveals he's spent Â£10,000 trying to live like it's the 1940s
item.description: Charlie Roy, 19, from Milton Keynes, believes his obsession with the wartime period was sparked by listening to his nan recount stories about working in an egg factory when he was a boy.

item.title: A statue to be proud of! People share photos of heartwarming monuments that 'enhance surroundings'
item.description: Historian James Barr, from London, urged Twitter users to share monuments they believe 'enhance their surroundings'. FEMAIL brings you some of the best from across the globe.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... Britain goes shopping again
item.description: 'Mum SAID she'd shop until she dropped'

item.title: Bird lovers in lockdown are asked to avoid helping 'abandoned' fledglings
item.description: The RSPB said it cares for more than 1,000 fledglings every year that normally do not need their help. Although the youngsters may be sitting on the ground, a parent is usually nearby.

item.title: The jaw-dropping images that have wowed the judges in the annual Moscow International Foto Awards
item.description: The annual Moscow International Foto Awards is now in its seventh year and has been flooded with entries from photographers in over 100 countries.
